snippet: Federal officials said the migrants — from Syria, Pakistan and Afghanistan — appeared to have no radical intentions, but the episodes added to concerns after the Paris attacks.
abstract: United States Border Patrol apprehends small groups of Syrians, Pakistanis and Afghans attempting to cross into country from Mexico; many US governors and other opponents of Pres Obama's proposal to resettle Middle Eastern refugees in US express alarm, despite authorities' screening process finding none were terrorists.

byline.contributor: Fernanda Santos, Julia Preston and Michael S. Schmidt contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: Federal officials said the migrants — from Syria, Pakistan and Afghanistan — appeared to have no radical intentions, but the episodes added to concerns after the Paris attacks.

headline.main: Migrants’ Attempts to Enter U.S. via Mexico Stoke Fears About Jihadists
headline.print_headline: Migrants’ Attempts to Enter U.S. via Mexico Stoke Fears About Jihadists

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Middle East and Africa Migrant Crisis
